intro: Fumaria supina, commonly known as the prostrate smokeplant, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a low-growing annual herb that typically reaches a height of less than 10 centimeters. The plant features slender, prostrate stems that are covered in fine, hairy hairs. Its small, yellowish flowers are clustered in loose racemes and bloom from late spring to early autumn. Fumaria supina is characterized by its distinctive, elongated, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating.
